abstract.para: This file provides documentation for file 96boslg1.dat, a comma delimited file that contains conductivity data for conservative tracer (NaBr) slug additions to the reference riffle in the Kuparuk river, June 28, 1996 and July 30, 1996, the fertilized zone riffle in the Kuparuk river June 29, 1996, and a riffle in fertilized zone of Oksrukuyik creek July 1, 1996.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Kuparuk river reference(+0.075km) and fertilized(+2.400km) zones, Oksrukuyik creek fertilized(+0.550km) zone.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATA RECEIVED: June 1997 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Karie Slavik DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: DATA:

para.literalLayout: General: A total of 500mL of a concentrated NaBr solution was injected to a hyporheic well at the upstream end of a riffle over 10 minutes. Thirty mL samples were collected from downstream hyporheic wells and the conductivity of those samples were determined immediately. Well Construction/Installation: Hyporheic samplers consisted of a 1/8 inch O.D. stainless steel (S.S.) tube housed in a 3/4 inch CPVC pipe. At the lower end of the CPVC a rubber stopper was inserted with the S.S tube protruding ten centimeters. A coupler was then used to attach a length of well screen to protect the S.S. tube. Samplers were inserted into the stream bed by forcing a pry bar into the stream bed to a depth of the maximum depth allowed, typically 30-60 centimeters. The sampler was then worked down into the hole and the pry bar removed, allowing the hole to cave in onto the sampler. The length of the sampler, still above the substrate, was measured and subtracted from the total length to find the depth of the sampler in the substrate. Samplers were allowed to settle before any testing occurred. Kuparuk river reference zone, June 28, 1996: Injection well: KR2 Injection start time: 11:20 Injection end time: 11:30 Kuparuk river reference zone, July 30, 1996: Injection well: KR3B Injection start time: 11:20 Injection end time: 11:30 Kuparuk river fertilized zone, June 29, 1996: Injection well: KF1B Injection start time: 11:10 Injection end time: 11:20 Oksrukuyik creek fertilized zone, July 1, 1996: Injection well: OC3B Injection start time: 10:40 Injection end time: 10:50

Notes: The variable, D/D for Distance on river is in reference to the top of the riffle and the established river markings. Use the X and Y coordinates (river right to left and distance downstream) for more detailed positions. (11) VARIABLE DESCRIPTIONS: Precision Coded?
